--- title: Program Evaluation (Applied Econometrics) Tools Workshop using STATA and R author: - name: Zahid Asghar affil: 1 twitter: zahedasghar email: g.zahid@gmail.com orcid: 0000-0002-1099-3857 main: true affiliation: - num: 1 address: School of Economics, Quaid-i-Azam University main_findings: - "[Learn **Data Analytics** with R + **Quarto Markdown**. register here](https://forms.gle/yzgTDuEZJDmGjzKHA)" - '![](images/za_icon_2.png){.main_pic}' logoleft_name: '![](){.main-img-left}' logoright_name: '![](){.main-img-right}' output: posterdown::posterdown_betterland: self_contained: false pandoc_args: --mathjax highlight: haddock number_sections: false link-citations: true bibliography: packages.bib --- # Introduction This training workshop is designed to focus on research design, thinking clearly with data with real life data applications through computer-based exercises and learn to reproduce the econometric results of published economic articles like Card (Nobel Laureate) and Krueger (1994). Philosophy of the course will be to enable participants in doing economics. Main software for the course will be R, and STATA with programs will also be provided for many of the topics. This course will ## Objectives 1. Emphasis on understanding problem solving techniques, rather than mathematical theorems and complex proofs 2. Developing a learning community to improve statistical and econometric skills necessary in the study of economics. 3. Some of the resources to be used for this course and freely available are listed as follows: ## Results ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Here is a caption for the figure. This can be added by using the "fig.cap" option in the r code chunk options, see this [link](https://yihui.name/knitr/options/#plots) from the legend himself, [Yihui Xie](https://twitter.com/xieyihui).](2023-01poster_files/figure-html/irisfigure-1.png){fig-align='center' width=80%} ::: ::: Maybe you want to show off some of that fancy code you spent so much time on to make that figure, well you can do that too! Just use the `echo=TRUE` option in the r code chunk options, Figure \@ref(fig:myprettycode)! ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Boxplots, so hot right now!](2023-01poster_files/figure-html/myprettycode-1.png){fig-align='center' width=80%} ::: ::: How about a neat table of data? See, Table \@ref(tab:iristable): ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: # References
